column5: Hey guys!  My carpet is ripped and i was going to change it.  But im not sure how to go about it.  Do I have to lift the plywood out or can i even do that?  Thanks in advance!  Lovetofish  http://i867.photobucket.com/albums/ab236/lovetofish123/carpet.jpg  http://i867.photobucket.com/albums/ab236/lovetofish123/carpet2.jpg
Tear out all that old carpet and just replace it "IF" the wood is still good...here's hoping it is....  Bob

We went a little further and actually cut the plywood in half. Going to carpet both pieces seperately and fit them back in. Wanted to be able to wrap the carpet, like they did from the factory. Planning on using marine carpet and the proper glue. Hoping I Will never have to touch it again.
Probably best to remove the wood and inspect while at it.
I did this on a old Starcraft of mine years ago....I primed the wood first before carpeting it....It came out very nice...wish I had pics but back then in the day there were no digital cameras..
I have 26 ounce marine carpet in gunmental grey and tan if your intersted.Some of the heaviest marine carpet you can buy. [emailÂ protected]
